classRec.name: Projection
classRec.description:
Contains common projection functions that can be used with IEnumerable.map
and other

method.name: property
method.description: Returns a selector function that retrieves a property from an element.
method.param: propertyName The property to map from each element
method.return: A function that returns the property value of propertyName or null if the element was null

method.name: toLowerCase
method.description: Returns a selector function that converts a string to lower case
method.return: A function that returns the string element as lower case or null if the element was null

method.name: toString
method.description: Returns a selector function that converts an object to a string
method.return: A function that returns the string representation of an element or null if the element was null

method.name: toUpperCase
method.description: Returns a selector function that converts a string to upper case
method.return: A function that returns the string element as lower case or null if the element was null

interfaceRec.name: IEnumerator
interfaceRec.description:
Contains the state of an active enumeration. This interface is rarely accessed
by client code as IEnumerable sequences can be used with `for each`

method.name: moveNext
method.description: Moves to the next value in the sequence
method.return: true if a new value is available; false if the end of the sequence has been reacheds

method.name: current
method.description: Returns the current value in the sequence

interfaceRec.name: IEnumerable
interfaceRec.description:
Represents a collection of values which can be enumerated using foreach, but
does not support random access

method.name: all
method.description:
Determines if the every value in the source sequence matches a predicate
function.
Uses immediate execution and stops enumerating when a negative match is found.
method.param: predicate (optional) A function in the format: function(element : TElement) : Boolean
method.return:
true if the sequence is empty or all the values in the sequence match the predicate;
false otherwise

method.name: any
method.description:
Determines if the predicate argument function returns true for any
item in the sequence. If no function is supplied, true will be returned
if the sequence contains any values
Uses immediate execution and stops enumerating when a match is found.
method.param: predicate (optional) A function in the format: function(element : TElement) : Boolean
method.return:
true if a matching value is found or if predicate is null and the
sequence contains any values; false otherwise

method.name: average
method.description:
Retrieves the average value in the sequence. Throws an IllegalOperationError
if the sequence is empty.
method.param: valueSelector (optional) If specified, determines the numeric value of the element
method.return: The average value of the sequence

method.name: concat
method.description:
Returns a new sequence that will seemlessly enumerate a second sequence after
the first sequence completes
method.param: second The sequence to enumerate after the first sequence
method.return: A new sequence that contains the values from the first and second sequence, in order

method.name: contains
method.description:
Determines if the source sequence contains a specific value, optionally
using an equalityComparer function.
Uses immediate execution and stops enumerating when a match is found
method.param: value The value to be compared

equalityComparer (optional) A function to compare two
values: function(x : TElement, y : TValue) : Boolean
method.return: true if a match was found; false otherwise

method.name: count
method.description: Determines the number of elements in the sequence. Uses immediate execution.
method.return: The number of elements in the sequence

method.name: defaultIfEmpty
method.description:
Returns a new sequence that will return the given defaultValue
Uses deferred execution
method.param:
defaultValue (optional) The default value to use if the sequence is empty.
If not supplied, the value will be converted from null (int = 0, boolean = false, etc)
method.return: A new IEnumerable sequence

method.name: distinct
method.description:
Returns a new sequence that only contains the unique values in the original sequence.
If the sequence contains values that are not natively comparable (String, u/int, Number, Boolean),
a hashSelector should be specified to return a value that is. An example of this would be to return
the ID property of an entity.
Uses deferred execution
method.param:
hashSelector (optional) If specified, returns a unique value for the element:
function(element : TElement) : THash
method.return: A new sequence that contains the distinct values of the original sequence

method.name: elementAtOrDefault
method.description:
Returns the element at the given index or a default value if
the sequence does not contain that many elements.
method.param: index The zero-based index of the value to return
method.return: The value at index
method.defaultValue: The value to return if the sequence does not contain (index+1) elements

method.name: elementAt
method.description:
Returns the element at the given index or throws an IllegalOperationError if
the sequence does not contain that many elements.
method.param: index The zero-based index of the value to return
method.return: The value at index

method.name: except
method.description:
Returns a new sequence that contains the values in the source sequence that
do not exist in the supplied sequence
method.param:
right The right side of the except. Can be any value that can be converted
to an IEnumerable using toEnumerable

hashSelector (optional) If specified, returns a unique value for the element:
function(element : TElement) : THash
method.return:
A new sequence containing the values contained in the source sequence but
not the "right" sequence

method.name: filter
method.description: Filters the source sequence based on a predicate function. Uses deferred execution.
method.param:
predicate A function that determines which elements should appear in the result:
function(element : TElement) : Boolean
method.return: A sequence that contains values from the source sequence for which predicate returned true

method.name: firstOrDefault
method.description:
Returns the first element in the sequence or returns a default value
if the sequence is empty. If predicate is supplied, the first value to match the
predicate will be returned with the default value being returned if no
values match the predicate
method.param: predicate (optional) A predicate used to match values: function(element : TElement) : Boolean
method.return: The first matching value in the sequence or defaultValue

method.name: first
method.description:
Returns the first element in the sequence or throws an IllegalOperationError
if the sequence is empty. If predicate is supplied, the first value to match the
predicate will be returned with an IllegalOperationError being thrown if no
values match the predicate
method.param: predicate (optional) A predicate used to match values: function(element : TElement) : Boolean
method.return: The first value in the sequence or the first value in the sequence that matches predicate

method.name: getEnumerator
method.description:
Returns an object that can be used to enumerate through this sequence. Access to this method
is not generally required as IEnumerable sequence
method.return: An IEnumerator

method.name: groupBy
method.description: Groups elements of a sequence using a key selector function
method.param:
keySelector Retrieves the key for a value in the sequence:
function(source : TSource) : TKey

elementSelector (optional) If specified, maps the source element to an element
to place in the grouping: function(source : TSource) : TElement

keyHashSelector (optional) If specified, returns a natively comparable value
for a key in the sequence: function(key : TKey) : THash
method.return:
A sequence that has elements of type IGrouping, where each IGrouping is a sequence
of values of type TElement and a key

method.name: groupJoin
method.description:
Correlates the elements of two sequences based on keys and groups the results
Uses immediate execution on the inner sequence, uses deferred executino on the outer (source)
sequence
method.param:
inner The sequence to join to the first sequence. Can be any value that can be converted
to an IEnumerable using toEnumerable

outerKeySelector Retrieves the key from values in the outer (source) sequence:
function(element : TOuterElement) : TKey

innerKeySelector Retrieves the key from values in the inner sequence:
function(element : TInnerElement) : TKey

resultSelector Creates a result element from the source sequence and a sequnce of
matching values from the inner sequence:
function(outer : TOuterElement, inner : IEnumerable.<TInnerElement>) : TResult

keyHashSelector (optional) Returns a natively comparable value for a key:
function(key : TKey) : THash
method.return:
A sequence that has elements of type TResult that are obtained by joining outer and inner
sequences.

method.name: intersect
method.description: Returns a new sequence that contains only the values contained in both sequences
method.param:
right The right side of the intersection. Can be any value that can be converted
to an IEnumerable using toEnumerable

hashSelector (optional) If specified, returns a unique value for the element:
function(element : TElement) : THash
method.return: A new sequence containing the unique values contained in both sequence

method.name: join
method.description:
Correlates the elements of two sequences based on keys.
Uses immediate execution on the inner sequence, uses deferred executino on the outer (source)
sequence
method.param:
inner The sequence to join to the first sequence. Can be any value that can be converted
to an IEnumerable using toEnumerable

outerKeySelector Retrieves the key from values in the outer (source) sequence:
function(element : TOuterElement) : TKey

innerKeySelector Retrieves the key from values in the inner sequence:
function(element : TInnerElement) : TKey

resultSelector Creates a result element from two matching elements:
function(outer : TOuterElement, inner : TInnerElement) : TResult

keyHashSelector (optional) Returns a natively comparable value for a key:
function(key : TKey) : THash
method.return:
A sequence that has elements of type TResult that are obtained by joining outer and inner
sequences.

method.name: lastOrDefault
method.description:
Returns the last element in the sequence or returns a default value
if the sequence is empty. If predicate is supplied, the last value to match the
predicate will be returned with the default value being returned if no
values match the predicate
method.param: predicate (optional) A predicate used to match values: function(element : TElement) : Boolean
method.return: The last matching value in the sequence or defaultValue

method.name: last
method.description:
Returns the last element in the sequence or throws an IllegalOperationError
if the sequence is empty. If predicate is supplied, the last value to match the
predicate will be returned with an IllegalOperationError being thrown if no
values match the predicate
method.param: predicate (optional) A predicate used to match values: function(element : TElement) : Boolean
method.return: The last matching value

method.name: mapMany
method.description:
Maps a sequence for each value in the source sequence and concatonates the results into
a single sequence. Uses deferred execution.
method.param:
collectionSelector A function to retrieve the sequence for a value in the source sequence:
function(element : TElement) : IEnumerable.<TCollection>

resultSelector (optional) A function that creates a result element from each source element
and each of its enumerated collection values:
function(element : TElement, value : TCollection) : TResult
method.return:
A sequence that contains values of type TResult if resultSelector is specified,
or TCollection if it is not.

method.name: map
method.description: Projects (converts) values using a selector function. Uses deferred execution
method.param:
selector Projects the values from the source sequence:
function(element : TElement) : TResult
method.return: A new sequence that contains the projected values of type TResult

method.name: max
method.description:
Retrieves the maximum element in the sequence. Throws an IllegalOperationError
if the sequence is empty.
If the comparison value (either the original element or the value returned by valueSelector)
cannot be natively ordered (ie. is not String, u/int or Number), a comparer should be supplied
to compare the values
method.param:
valueSelector (optional) If specified, determines the value to be
compared for each element in the sequence: function(element : TElement) : TValue

comparer (optional) If specified, compares the value (either element
value or the value returned by valueSelector):
function(value : TValue) : int
method.return: The sequence element deemed to be the maximum value

method.name: min
method.description:
Retrieves the minimum element in the sequence. Throws an IllegalOperationError
if the sequence is empty
If the comparison value (either the original element or the value returned by valueSelector)
cannot be natively ordered (ie. is not String, u/int or Number), a comparer should be supplied
to compare the values
method.param:
valueSelector (optional) If specified, determines the value to be
compared for each element in the sequence: function(element : TElement) : TValue

comparer (optional) If specified, compares the value (either element
value or the value returned by valueSelector):
function(value : TValue) : int
method.return: The sequence element deemed to be the minimum value

method.name: ofType
method.description: Filters values from a sequence based on their type
method.param: cls A class on which to filter values from the source sequence.
method.return:
A sequence that contains only elements from the source sequence that are of type
cls (or a subclass)

method.name: orderByDescending
method.description: Orders the values in the source sequence in descending order
method.param:
keySelector A function that retrieves the key used to order the values in the source sequence:
function(element : TElement) : TKey

comparer (optional) A function that compares key values. The return value should follow rules of
the compareFunction in Array.sort: function(x : TKey, y : TKey) : int
method.return:
An IOrderedObservable that can be enumerated or further ordered using methods
available on IOrderedObservable

method.name: orderBy
method.description: Orders the values in the source sequence in ascending order
method.param:
keySelector A function that retrieves the key used to order the values in the source sequence:
function(element : TElement) : TKey

comparer (optional) A function that compares key values. The return value should follow rules of
the compareFunction in Array.sort: function(x : TKey, y : TKey) : int
method.return:
An IOrderedObservable that can be enumerated or further ordered using methods
available on IOrderedObservable

method.name: reduce
method.description:
Aggregates values in a sequence using functions passed as arguments.
Accumulates a value, starting with seed, by calling accumulator for each value in the source
sequence and using the return value as the new accumulated value. When the sequence completes,
the accumulated value is (optonally) mapped through resultSelector before being returned.
method.param: seed The initial value for the accumulation

accumulator A function that returns the new accumulated value:
function(accumulate : TAccumulate, element : TElement) : TAccumulate
resultSelector (optional) A function that maps the final accumulate value before being returned
method.return:
The return value of resultSelector (if supplied) or the final accumulate value if
resultSelector is not supplied

method.name: repeat
method.description: Repeats the source sequence a specified number of times
method.param:
count (optional) The number of times to repeat the sequence. If 0, the
sequence will be repeated indefinately
method.return: A sequence containing values of the same type as the source

method.name: reverse
method.description: Reverses the values in the source sequence
method.return: A new sequence containing the reversed values of the source sequence

method.name: scan
method.description:
Returns a sequence that aggregates values using functions passed as arguments, using
deferred execution and returning the values accumulated values as they are returned.
Accumulates a value, starting with seed, by calling accumulator for each value in the
source sequence and using the return value as the new accumulated value. Each time
a new value is accumulated, the accumulated value is (optonally) mapped through
resultSelector before being returned.
method.param: seed The initial value for the accumulation

accumulator A function that returns the new accumulated value:
function(accumulate : TAccumulate, element : TElement) : TAccumulate
resultSelector (optional) A function that maps the final accumulate value before being returned
method.return: A sequence of type TAccumulate that can be enumerated

method.name: sequenceEqual
method.description: Determines whether two sequences are equal. Uses immediate execution
method.param: right Ths sequence to compare to the source

comparer A function that will determine equality between left and right values:
function(left : TLeft, right : TRight) : Boolean
method.return: true if the sequences are of equal length and all of their values are equal

method.name: singleOrDefault
method.description:
Returns the first element in the sequence or throws an IllegalOperationError
if the sequence does contains multiple values, but returns a default value if
the sequence returns no values. If predicate is supplied, the first value to match
the predicate will be returned with an IllegalOperationError
being thrown if the sequence contains more than one match and a default value being
returned if no matches are found
method.param: defaultValue A defaultValue to
predicate (optional) A predicate used to match values: function(element : TElement) : Boolean
method.return: The first matching value in the sequence or defaultValue

method.name: single
method.description:
Returns the first element in the sequence or throws an IllegalOperationError
if the sequence does not contain exactly one value. If predicate is supplied,
the first value to match the predicate will be returned with an IllegalOperationError
being thrown if the sequence does not contain exactly one match
method.param: predicate (optional) A predicate used to match values: function(element : TElement) : Boolean
method.return: The first value in the sequence or the first value in the sequence that matches predicate

method.name: skipLast
method.description:
Returns a new sequence that excludes the specified number of values from
the end of the source sequence
method.param: count The number of elements to skip from the end of source sequence
method.return: A new sequence containing values of the same type as the source sequence

method.name: skipWhile
method.description:
Returns a new sequence that skips values from the source sequence
until a specified predicate returns false, at which point values will be
returned from the rest of sequence
method.param:
predicate A function that determines whether values should still be skipped
from the source sequence: function(element:TElement) : Boolean
method.return: A new sequence containing values of the same type as the source sequence

method.name: skip
method.description:
Returns a new sequence that excludes the specified number of values from
the start of the source sequence
method.param: count The number of elements to skip from the source sequence
method.return: A new sequence containing values of the same type as the source sequence

method.name: sum
method.description: Returns the total numeric value of every value in the sequence
method.param:
valueSelector (optional) If specified, can be used to specify the numeric
value for each element in the sequence
method.return: The summed values of each element in the sequence

method.name: takeLast
method.description:
Returns a new sequence that includes a maximum number of elements to take from
the end of the first sequence
method.param: count The number of elements to take from the end of source sequence
method.return: A new sequence containing values of the same type as the source sequence

method.name: takeWhile
method.description:
Returns a new sequence that includes values from the source sequence
until a specified predicate returns false, at which point the sequence will end
method.param:
predicate A function that determines whether values should still be taken
from the source sequence: function(element:TElement) : Boolean
method.return: A new sequence containing values of the same type as the source sequence

method.name: take
method.description: Returns a new sequence that includes a maximum number of elements from the first sequence
method.param: count The number of elements to take from the source sequence
method.return: A new sequence containing values of the same type as the source sequence

method.name: toArray
method.description: Retrieves an array containing all the values in the sequence
method.return: An Array containing values of the same type as the source sequence

method.name: toDictionary
method.description: Converts the sequence to a Dictionary. Uses immediate execution
method.param: keySelector Retrieves the key for each element in the sequence

elementSelector (optional) If specified, provides the "values"
in the lookup. If not specified, the original element will be used
method.return: A Dictionary

method.name: toLookup
method.description:
Converts the sequence to an ILookup, which is simiular to a Dictionary with the following differences:
  • Supports null keys
  • Returns an empty sequence for requests for keys that do not exist
Uses immediate execution
method.param: keySelector Retrieves the key for each element in the sequence

elementSelector (optional) If specified, provides the "values"
in the lookup. If not specified, the original element will be used

keyHashSelector (optional) If the value returned by keySelector is not natively
comparable (ie. String, u/int, Number, Boolean), keyHashSelector can be used to
provide comparable values for the keys: function(key : TKey) : THash
method.return: An ILookup

method.name: toObservable
method.description: Converts the interactive sequence to an observable sequence, optionally using a scheduler
method.param:
scheduler (optional) The scheduler to use to distribute the values. Defaults to
Scheduler.asynchronous
method.return: An observable sequence that contains values of the same type as the source sequence

method.name: union
method.description: Returns a new sequence that contains the unique values across two sequences
method.param:
right The right side of the union. Can be any value that can be converted
to an IEnumerable using toEnumerable

hashSelector (optional) If specified, returns a unique value for the element:
function(element : TElement) : THash
method.return: A new sequence containing the distinct values across both sequences

method.name: zip
method.description: Pairs values from two sequences in order and uses a selector function to project the results
method.param: right The sequence to pair with the left (source) sequence

resultSelector A function to map values from the left and right sequences:
function(left : TLeft, right : TRight) : TResult
method.return: A sequence containing values of type TResult

interfaceRec.name: IOrderedEnumerable
interfaceRec.description: An enumerable sequence that has ordering applied to it

method.name: thenByDescending
method.description: Adds a secondary, descending, sort condition to the IOrderedEnumerable
method.param:
keySelector A function that retrieves the key used to order the values in the source sequence:
function(element : TElement) : TKey

comparer (optional) A function that compares key values. The return value should follow rules of
the compareFunction in Array.sort: function(x : TKey, y : TKey) : int
method.return:
An IOrderedObservable that can be enumerated or further ordered using methods
available on IOrderedObservable

method.name: thenBy
method.description: Adds a secondary sort condition to the IOrderedEnumerable
method.param:
keySelector A function that retrieves the key used to order the values in the source sequence:
function(element : TElement) : TKey

comparer (optional) A function that compares key values. The return value should follow rules of
the compareFunction in Array.sort: function(x : TKey, y : TKey) : int
method.return:
An IOrderedObservable that can be enumerated or further ordered using methods
available on IOrderedObservable

interfaceRec.name: IGrouping
interfaceRec.description: Contains a list of grouped values and a key identifying the group

method.name: key
method.description: Returns the key that identifies this grouping

method.name: getValues
method.description:
Returns a sequence of values for the specified key or
an empty sequence if the key has no values
method.param: key The key to lookup
method.return: An IEnumerable sequence of values

method.name: toEnumerable
method.description:
Converts a value to an IEnumerable sequence. It can be considered to have the following overloads:
  • function():IEnumerable - returns an empty sequence
  • function(array : Array):IEnumerable - returns a sequence that wraps an array
  • function(enumerable : IEnumerable):IEnumerable - returns enumerable
  • function(proxy : Proxy):IEnumerable - returns enumerable that wraps an enumerable Proxy
  • function(value : :IEnumerable - returns enumerable that contains a single value

classRec.name: Enumerable
classRec.description: Provides static methods that create IEnumerable sequences

method.name: create
method.description: Creates an enumerable sequence that uses callbacks
method.param:
moveNext Moves to the next item in the sequence, returning false when no more items exist:
function():Boolean
getCurrent Retrieves the current value in the sequence: function():TElement
method.return: An IEnumerable that contains values of type TElement

method.name: empty
method.description: Creates an empty sequence

method.name: fromArray
method.description: Creates an enumerable sequence from an array
method.param: array The array to enumerate
method.return: An IEnumerable containing values of the same type as array

method.name: fromProxy
method.description: Creates a sequence from an enumerable proxy object
method.param: proxy A enumerable proxy
method.return: A sequence that will enumerate through the values in the proxy

method.name: generate
method.description: Creates an enumerable sequence by calling back to functions that mainpulate its state
method.param: initialState The initial state value

predicate A function called once for every value (including initialState), returns true while
the sequence has more values: function(state : TState) : Boolean

iterate A function called once for every value (excluding initialState) and returns the new
value for state: function(state : TState) : TState

resultMap A function that maps the current state to a value:
function(state : TState) : TResult
method.return: An IEnumerable sequence that contains values of type TResult

method.name: range
method.description:
Creates an enumerable sequence that contains the numbers in a
specified range
method.param: start The start value
count The number of values to enumerate, including start
method.return: An IEnumerable of int values in the specified range

method.name: repeat
method.description: Creates an enumerable sequence that repeats a value
method.param: val The value to repeat
count The number of times to repeat. A value of 0 will repeat indefinately
method.return: An IEnumerable containing the repeated value

method.name: value
method.description: Creates a sequence that contains a single value
method.param: value The value to wrap in a sequence
method.return: A sequence containing the specified value

classRec.name: AbsEnumerable
classRec.description: An abstract implementation of IEnumerable. This class may be made inaccessible in future revisions.

method.name: all
method.description:
Determines if the every value in the source sequence matches a predicate
function.
Uses immediate execution and stops enumerating when a negative match is found.
method.param: predicate (optional) A function in the format: function(element : TElement) : Boolean
method.return:
true if the sequence is empty or all the values in the sequence match the predicate;
false otherwise

method.name: any
method.description:
Determines if the predicate argument function returns true for any
item in the sequence. If no function is supplied, true will be returned
if the sequence contains any values
Uses immediate execution and stops enumerating when a match is found.
method.param: predicate (optional) A function in the format: function(element : TElement) : Boolean
method.return:
true if a matching value is found or if predicate is null and the
sequence contains any values; false otherwise

method.name: average
method.description:
Retrieves the average value in the sequence. Throws an IllegalOperationError
if the sequence is empty.
method.param: valueSelector (optional) If specified, determines the numeric value of the element
method.return: The average value of the sequence

method.name: cancel
method.description: Cancels the operation

method.name: concat
method.description:
Returns a new sequence that will seemlessly enumerate a second sequence after
the first sequence completes
method.param: second The sequence to enumerate after the first sequence
method.return: A new sequence that contains the values from the first and second sequence, in order

method.name: contains
method.description:
Determines if the source sequence contains a specific value, optionally
using an equalityComparer function.
Uses immediate execution and stops enumerating when a match is found
method.param: value The value to be compared

equalityComparer (optional) A function to compare two
values: function(x : TElement, y : TValue) : Boolean
method.return: true if a match was found; false otherwise

method.name: count
method.description: Determines the number of elements in the sequence. Uses immediate execution.
method.return: The number of elements in the sequence

method.name: defaultIfEmpty
method.description:
Returns a new sequence that will return the given defaultValue
Uses deferred execution
method.param:
defaultValue (optional) The default value to use if the sequence is empty.
If not supplied, the value will be converted from null (int = 0, boolean = false, etc)
method.return: A new IEnumerable sequence

method.name: distinct
method.description:
Returns a new sequence that only contains the unique values in the original sequence.
If the sequence contains values that are not natively comparable (String, u/int, Number, Boolean),
a hashSelector should be specified to return a value that is. An example of this would be to return
the ID property of an entity.
Uses deferred execution
method.param:
hashSelector (optional) If specified, returns a unique value for the element:
function(element : TElement) : THash
method.return: A new sequence that contains the distinct values of the original sequence

method.name: elementAtOrDefault
method.description:
Returns the element at the given index or a default value if
the sequence does not contain that many elements.
method.param: index The zero-based index of the value to return
method.return: The value at index

method.name: elementAt
method.description:
Returns the element at the given index or throws an IllegalOperationError if
the sequence does not contain that many elements.
method.param: index The zero-based index of the value to return
method.return: The value at index

method.name: except
method.description:
Returns a new sequence that contains the values in the source sequence that
do not exist in the supplied sequence
method.param:
right The right side of the except. Can be any value that can be converted
to an IEnumerable using toEnumerable

hashSelector (optional) If specified, returns a unique value for the element:
function(element : TElement) : THash
method.return:
A new sequence containing the values contained in the source sequence but
not the "right" sequence

method.name: filter
method.description: Filters the source sequence based on a predicate function. Uses deferred execution.
method.param:
predicate A function that determines which elements should appear in the result:
function(element : TElement) : Boolean
method.return: A sequence that contains values from the source sequence for which predicate returned true

method.name: firstOrDefault
method.description:
Returns the first element in the sequence or returns a default value
if the sequence is empty. If predicate is supplied, the first value to match the
predicate will be returned with the default value being returned if no
values match the predicate
method.param: predicate (optional) A predicate used to match values: function(element : TElement) : Boolean
method.return: The first matching value in the sequence or defaultValue

method.name: first
method.description:
Returns the first element in the sequence or throws an IllegalOperationError
if the sequence is empty. If predicate is supplied, the first value to match the
predicate will be returned with an IllegalOperationError being thrown if no
values match the predicate
method.param: predicate (optional) A predicate used to match values: function(element : TElement) : Boolean
method.return: The first value in the sequence or the first value in the sequence that matches predicate

method.name: groupBy
method.description: Groups elements of a sequence using a key selector function
method.param:
keySelector Retrieves the key for a value in the sequence:
function(source : TSource) : TKey

elementSelector (optional) If specified, maps the source element to an element
to place in the grouping: function(source : TSource) : TElement

keyHashSelector (optional) If specified, returns a natively comparable value
for a key in the sequence: function(key : TKey) : THash
method.return:
A sequence that has elements of type IGrouping, where each IGrouping is a sequence
of values of type TElement and a key

method.name: groupJoin
method.description:
Correlates the elements of two sequences based on keys and groups the results
Uses immediate execution on the inner sequence, uses deferred executino on the outer (source)
sequence
method.param:
inner The sequence to join to the first sequence. Can be any value that can be converted
to an IEnumerable using toEnumerable

outerKeySelector Retrieves the key from values in the outer (source) sequence:
function(element : TOuterElement) : TKey

innerKeySelector Retrieves the key from values in the inner sequence:
function(element : TInnerElement) : TKey

resultSelector Creates a result element from the source sequence and a sequnce of
matching values from the inner sequence:
function(outer : TOuterElement, inner : IEnumerable.<TInnerElement>) : TResult

keyHashSelector (optional) Returns a natively comparable value for a key:
function(key : TKey) : THash
method.return:
A sequence that has elements of type TResult that are obtained by joining outer and inner
sequences.

method.name: intersect
method.description: Returns a new sequence that contains only the values contained in both sequences
method.param:
right The right side of the intersection. Can be any value that can be converted
to an IEnumerable using toEnumerable

hashSelector (optional) If specified, returns a unique value for the element:
function(element : TElement) : THash
method.return: A new sequence containing the unique values contained in both sequence

method.name: join
method.description:
Correlates the elements of two sequences based on keys.
Uses immediate execution on the inner sequence, uses deferred executino on the outer (source)
sequence
method.param:
inner The sequence to join to the first sequence. Can be any value that can be converted
to an IEnumerable using toEnumerable

outerKeySelector Retrieves the key from values in the outer (source) sequence:
function(element : TOuterElement) : TKey

innerKeySelector Retrieves the key from values in the inner sequence:
function(element : TInnerElement) : TKey

resultSelector Creates a result element from two matching elements:
function(outer : TOuterElement, inner : TInnerElement) : TResult

keyHashSelector (optional) Returns a natively comparable value for a key:
function(key : TKey) : THash
method.return:
A sequence that has elements of type TResult that are obtained by joining outer and inner
sequences.

method.name: lastOrDefault
method.description:
Returns the last element in the sequence or returns a default value
if the sequence is empty. If predicate is supplied, the last value to match the
predicate will be returned with the default value being returned if no
values match the predicate
method.param: predicate (optional) A predicate used to match values: function(element : TElement) : Boolean
method.return: The last matching value in the sequence or defaultValue

method.name: last
method.description:
Returns the last element in the sequence or throws an IllegalOperationError
if the sequence is empty. If predicate is supplied, the last value to match the
predicate will be returned with an IllegalOperationError being thrown if no
values match the predicate
method.param: predicate (optional) A predicate used to match values: function(element : TElement) : Boolean
method.return: The last matching value

method.name: mapMany
method.description:
Maps a sequence for each value in the source sequence and concatonates the results into
a single sequence. Uses deferred execution.
method.param:
collectionSelector A function to retrieve the sequence for a value in the source sequence:
function(element : TElement) : IEnumerable.<TCollection>

resultSelector (optional) A function that creates a result element from each source element
and each of its enumerated collection values:
function(element : TElement, value : TCollection) : TResult
method.return:
A sequence that contains values of type TResult if resultSelector is specified,
or TCollection if it is not.

method.name: map
method.description: Projects (converts) values using a selector function. Uses deferred execution
method.param:
selector Projects the values from the source sequence:
function(element : TElement) : TResult
method.return: A new sequence that contains the projected values of type TResult

method.name: max
method.description:
Retrieves the maximum element in the sequence. Throws an IllegalOperationError
if the sequence is empty.
If the comparison value (either the original element or the value returned by valueSelector)
cannot be natively ordered (ie. is not String, u/int or Number), a comparer should be supplied
to compare the values
method.param:
valueSelector (optional) If specified, determines the value to be
compared for each element in the sequence: function(element : TElement) : TValue

comparer (optional) If specified, compares the value (either element
value or the value returned by valueSelector):
function(value : TValue) : int
method.return: The sequence element deemed to be the maximum value

method.name: min
method.description:
Retrieves the minimum element in the sequence. Throws an IllegalOperationError
if the sequence is empty
If the comparison value (either the original element or the value returned by valueSelector)
cannot be natively ordered (ie. is not String, u/int or Number), a comparer should be supplied
to compare the values
method.param:
valueSelector (optional) If specified, determines the value to be
compared for each element in the sequence: function(element : TElement) : TValue

comparer (optional) If specified, compares the value (either element
value or the value returned by valueSelector):
function(value : TValue) : int
method.return: The sequence element deemed to be the minimum value

method.name: ofType
method.description: Filters values from a sequence based on their type
method.param: cls A class on which to filter values from the source sequence.
method.return:
A sequence that contains only elements from the source sequence that are of type
cls (or a subclass)

method.name: orderByDescending
method.description: Orders the values in the source sequence in descending order
method.param:
keySelector A function that retrieves the key used to order the values in the source sequence:
function(element : TElement) : TKey

comparer (optional) A function that compares key values. The return value should follow rules of
the compareFunction in Array.sort: function(x : TKey, y : TKey) : int
method.return:
An IOrderedObservable that can be enumerated or further ordered using methods
available on IOrderedObservable

method.name: orderBy
method.description: Orders the values in the source sequence in ascending order
method.param:
keySelector A function that retrieves the key used to order the values in the source sequence:
function(element : TElement) : TKey

comparer (optional) A function that compares key values. The return value should follow rules of
the compareFunction in Array.sort: function(x : TKey, y : TKey) : int
method.return:
An IOrderedObservable that can be enumerated or further ordered using methods
available on IOrderedObservable

method.name: reduce
method.description:
Aggregates values in a sequence using functions passed as arguments.
Accumulates a value, starting with seed, by calling accumulator for each value in the source
sequence and using the return value as the new accumulated value. When the sequence completes,
the accumulated value is (optonally) mapped through resultSelector before being returned.
method.param: seed The initial value for the accumulation

accumulator A function that returns the new accumulated value:
function(accumulate : TAccumulate, element : TElement) : TAccumulate
resultSelector (optional) A function that maps the final accumulate value before being returned
method.return:
The return value of resultSelector (if supplied) or the final accumulate value if
resultSelector is not supplied

method.name: repeat
method.description: Repeats the source sequence a specified number of times
method.param:
count (optional) The number of times to repeat the sequence. If 0, the
sequence will be repeated indefinately
method.return: A sequence containing values of the same type as the source

method.name: reverse
method.description: Reverses the values in the source sequence
method.return: A new sequence containing the reversed values of the source sequence

method.name: scan
method.description:
Returns a sequence that aggregates values using functions passed as arguments, using
deferred execution and returning the values accumulated values as they are returned.
Accumulates a value, starting with seed, by calling accumulator for each value in the
source sequence and using the return value as the new accumulated value. Each time
a new value is accumulated, the accumulated value is (optonally) mapped through
resultSelector before being returned.
method.param: seed The initial value for the accumulation

accumulator A function that returns the new accumulated value:
function(accumulate : TAccumulate, element : TElement) : TAccumulate
resultSelector (optional) A function that maps the final accumulate value before being returned
method.return: A sequence of type TAccumulate that can be enumerated

method.name: sequenceEqual
method.description: Determines whether two sequences are equal. Uses immediate execution
method.param: right Ths sequence to compare to the source

comparer A function that will determine equality between left and right values:
function(left : TLeft, right : TRight) : Boolean
method.return: true if the sequences are of equal length and all of their values are equal

method.name: singleOrDefault
method.description:
Returns the first element in the sequence or throws an IllegalOperationError
if the sequence does contains multiple values, but returns a default value if
the sequence returns no values. If predicate is supplied, the first value to match
the predicate will be returned with an IllegalOperationError
being thrown if the sequence contains more than one match and a default value being
returned if no matches are found
method.param: defaultValue A defaultValue to
predicate (optional) A predicate used to match values: function(element : TElement) : Boolean
method.return: The first matching value in the sequence or defaultValue

method.name: single
method.description:
Returns the first element in the sequence or throws an IllegalOperationError
if the sequence does not contain exactly one value. If predicate is supplied,
the first value to match the predicate will be returned with an IllegalOperationError
being thrown if the sequence does not contain exactly one match
method.param: predicate (optional) A predicate used to match values: function(element : TElement) : Boolean
method.return: The first value in the sequence or the first value in the sequence that matches predicate

method.name: skipLast
method.description:
Returns a new sequence that excludes the specified number of values from
the end of the source sequence
method.param: count The number of elements to skip from the end of source sequence
method.return: A new sequence containing values of the same type as the source sequence

method.name: skipWhile
method.description:
Returns a new sequence that skips values from the source sequence
until a specified predicate returns false, at which point values will be
returned from the rest of sequence
method.param:
predicate A function that determines whether values should still be skipped
from the source sequence: function(element:TElement) : Boolean
method.return: A new sequence containing values of the same type as the source sequence

method.name: skip
method.description:
Returns a new sequence that excludes the specified number of values from
the start of the source sequence
method.param: count The number of elements to skip from the source sequence
method.return: A new sequence containing values of the same type as the source sequence

method.name: sum
method.description: Returns the total numeric value of every value in the sequence
method.param:
valueSelector (optional) If specified, can be used to specify the numeric
value for each element in the sequence
method.return: The summed values of each element in the sequence

method.name: takeLast
method.description:
Returns a new sequence that includes a maximum number of elements to take from
the end of the first sequence
method.param: count The number of elements to take from the end of source sequence
method.return: A new sequence containing values of the same type as the source sequence

method.name: takeWhile
method.description:
Returns a new sequence that includes values from the source sequence
until a specified predicate returns false, at which point the sequence will end
method.param:
predicate A function that determines whether values should still be taken
from the source sequence: function(element:TElement) : Boolean
method.return: A new sequence containing values of the same type as the source sequence

method.name: take
method.description: Returns a new sequence that includes a maximum number of elements from the first sequence
method.param: count The number of elements to take from the source sequence
method.return: A new sequence containing values of the same type as the source sequence

method.name: toArray
method.description: Retrieves an array containing all the values in the sequence
method.return: An Array containing values of the same type as the source sequence

method.name: toDictionary
method.description: Converts the sequence to a Dictionary. Uses immediate execution
method.param: keySelector Retrieves the key for each element in the sequence

elementSelector (optional) If specified, provides the "values"
in the lookup. If not specified, the original element will be used
method.return: A Dictionary

method.name: toLookup
method.description:
Converts the sequence to an ILookup, which is simiular to a Dictionary with the following differences:
  • Supports null keys
  • Returns an empty sequence for requests for keys that do not exist
Uses immediate execution
method.param: keySelector Retrieves the key for each element in the sequence

elementSelector (optional) If specified, provides the "values"
in the lookup. If not specified, the original element will be used

keyHashSelector (optional) If the value returned by keySelector is not natively
comparable (ie. String, u/int, Number, Boolean), keyHashSelector can be used to
provide comparable values for the keys: function(key : TKey) : THash
method.return: An ILookup

method.name: toObservable
method.description: Converts the interactive sequence to an observable sequence, optionally using a scheduler
method.param:
scheduler (optional) The scheduler to use to distribute the values. Defaults to
Scheduler.asynchronous
method.return: An observable sequence that contains values of the same type as the source sequence

method.name: union
method.description: Returns a new sequence that contains the unique values across two sequences
method.param:
right The right side of the union. Can be any value that can be converted
to an IEnumerable using toEnumerable

hashSelector (optional) If specified, returns a unique value for the element:
function(element : TElement) : THash
method.return: A new sequence containing the distinct values across both sequences

method.name: zip
method.description: Pairs values from two sequences in order and uses a selector function to project the results
method.param: right The sequence to pair with the left (source) sequence

resultSelector A function to map values from the left and right sequences:
function(left : TLeft, right : TRight) : TResult
method.return: A sequence containing values of type TResult

classRec.name: Unit
classRec.description:
Represents a valueClass that can be used when
an observable sequence logically has no valueClass

interfaceRec.name: ICancelable
interfaceRec.description: Represents a handle that can be used to cancel an operation

method.name: cancel
method.description: Cancels the operation

classRec.name: Plan
classRec.description:
A combination of IObservable sequences and a selector that will map the values of those sequences to an output value. A plan is intended to be used with Observable.when

Generally, a Plan will be created using Pattern.then(), rather than creating a Plan directly

method.name: selector
method.description:
Gets the function selector that will accept one argument for each
sequence in sources and return the output value

method.name: sources
method.description: Gets the observable sequences in this plan

interfaceRec.name: IObserver
interfaceRec.description: An object that receives messages from an IObservable sequence

method.name: onCompleted
method.description:
Notifies the subscriber that the sequence has completed and
that no more messages will be received

method.name: onError
method.description:
Notifies the subscriber that the sequence has halted with an error
and that no more messages will be received

method.name: onNext
method.description: Notifies the subscriber that a value has been received

classRec.name: TimeStamped
classRec.description: A wrapper that adds a timestamp to a value

method.name: TimeStamped
method.description: Creates a TimeStamped wrapper
method.param: value The value from the original sequence
time The timestamp value

method.name: timestamp
method.description: Gets the timestamp value

method.name: value
method.description: Gets the original value

classRec.name: TimeInterval
classRec.description:
A wrapper that adds the time interval, in milliseconds,
since the last values

method.name: interval
method.description:
Gets the internal, in milliseconds,
since the last value

method.name: value
method.description: Gets the original value

classRec.name: NotificationKind
classRec.description: Enumeration for the different types of Notification

classRec.name: CompositeCancelable
classRec.description:
Represents a cancelable resource that controls multiple
other cancelable resources

method.name: CompositeCancelable
method.description:
Creates a composite cancelable instance with the cancelable
instances to start with

method.name: add
method.description:
Adds a cancelable resource to the list of cancelable resources. If
this instance has already been canceled, the resource will be immediately
canceled and not added to the list.

method.name: cancel
method.description: Cancels (and removes) all resources in this instance

method.name: remove
method.description: Removes a cancelable resource from the list

method.name: cancelables
method.description: Gets the list of cancelable resources in this instance

method.name: count
method.description: Gets the number of resources in this list

classRec.name: BooleanCancelable
classRec.description:
Represents a cancelable operation, the canceled status of which can
be checked by isCanceled

method.name: cancel
method.description: Cancels the operation. isCanceled will return true after this call.

method.name: isCanceled
method.description: Determines if canceled() has been called on this instance

classRec.name: TimeoutError
classRec.description: An error thrown by Observable.timeout by default

classRec.name: Pattern
classRec.description:
A combination of multiple IObservable sequences that can be combined into a Plan

Generally, a Pattern will be created using IObservable.and or Pattern.and(), rather than creating a Pattern directly

method.name: and
method.description:
Creates another pattern that combines the IObservable sequences
of this Pattern with another IObservable sequence
method.param: source The IObservable sequence to add
method.return: A Pattern with the new set of sequences

method.name: then
method.description:
Creates a Plan from this Pattern, by supplying a
valueClass and a mappingFunction for the values from each
sequence in this Pattern
method.param: valueClass The valueClass that will be returned by thenFunction

thenFunction The function that will accept one argument for each
sequence in the pattern and output a valueClass
method.return: A Plan that can be used with Observable.when

classRec.name: MutableCancelable
classRec.description: A cancelable resource than is not immediately available

method.name: cancel
method.description: Cancels the operation for current and future innerCancelable values

method.name: cancelable
method.description:
Assigns the cancelable operation.
If an existing value exists for innerCancelable, it will be canceled.
If cancel() has already been called on this FutureCancelable, the value
will be instantly canceled and innerCancelable will be null

classRec.name: Notification
classRec.description:
Represents one of the three messages that can be sent to
an observer.

method.name: acceptWith
method.description: Calls the appropriate method on an observer

method.name: accept
method.description: Calls the appropriate method

method.name: error
method.description: Gets the error associated with this message or null if there is no error.

method.name: hasValue
method.description: Determined whether this instance has a value property available

method.name: kind
method.description: Gets the NotificationKind of this instance

method.name: value
method.description: Gets the value associated with this message

interfaceRec.name: IObservable
interfaceRec.description:
An observable (or "push"), sequence of values that often represent data or events that have not yet occured.
Sequences can be manipulated, often combining them with other sequences, and then subscribed to
to receive the output.
Chains of sequences are automatically torn down when the sequence completes, errors or is unsubscribed from.

method.name: all
method.description: Determines if all values in the source sequence satisfy a condition
method.param: predicate The predicate that determines if a value in the sequence is valid.
method.return: An observable sequence of Boolean

method.name: and
method.description: Creates a pattern by combining the current source with right.
method.param: right The other sequence to combine with the pattern.
method.return: A pattern representing both sequences

method.name: any
method.description: Determines if the source sequence contains a value that satisfies a condition
method.param:
predicate (optional) The predicate that determines if a value in the sequence is valid.
If null, the returned sequence will emit true if the source sequence contains any values or false if it is empty.
method.return: An observable sequence of Boolean

method.name: asObservable
method.description: Hides the source sequence so it cannot be cast back to its concrete implementation
method.return: An observable sequence of the same type as the current sequence

method.name: average
method.description: Returns the average value of all the elements in the source sequence
method.param: valueSelector (optional) The selector function that returns a numeric value from the source value
method.return: An observable sequence of TSource values

method.name: bufferWithCount
method.description: Emits the values from a source sequence in groups of a specific size
method.param: count The number of values to buffer
skip The number of values to offset after the buffer is emitted.
method.return: An observable sequence of arrays of the the same type as the current sequence

method.name: bufferWithTimeOrCount
method.description:
Buffers values into an array, with one array for either a maximum period of time or a maximum number
of values, whichever occurs first
method.param: timeMs The maximum amount of time to buffer values for
count The maximum amount of values to include in a single buffer
method.return: An observable sequence of observable sequences with the same type as the current sequence

method.name: bufferWithTime
method.description: Emits the values from a source sequence in groups of a specific size
method.param: timeMs The amount of time to buffer before the values are released
timeShiftMs The amount of time to offset after the buffer is emitted
scheduler The scheduler to use
method.return: An observable sequence of Arrays of the same type as the current sequence

method.name: cast
method.description: Forces values from a source sequence to be of a specific class
method.param: valueClass The valueClass of the output sequence
method.return: An observable sequence of valueClass

method.name: catchErrorDefer
method.description: Runs a specific sequence, determined at runtime, when an error occurs
method.param: errorClass The class (and superclass) of error to act on
deferFunc The function to execute in the event of an error. Signature is function(e : Error) : IObservable
method.return: An observable sequence of the same valueClass as the current sequence

method.name: catchError
method.description: Runs a specific sequence when an error occurs
method.param: second The sequence to subscribe to when an error occurs
method.return: An observable sequence of the same type as the current sequence

method.name: chain
method.description:
Chains together sequences, starting with the current sequence, using selector functions that
return a sequence for values of the previous.
method.return:
An observable sequence of the values returned by the sequence returned by the last
selector in the chain

method.name: combineLatest
method.description: Merges two sequences through a mapping function, using the latest value from either source
method.param: right The sequence to combine with
selector The function that combines values from the two sources. Signature is function(left : this.valueClass, right : right.valueClass) : returnType
method.return: An observable sequence of returnType

method.name: concatMany
method.description:
Evaluates a new sequence for each value using a selector function and waits for the returned
sequence to complete before resolving the next sequence
method.param:
selector Accept a value of the source and returns the IObservable sequence to concatonate:
function(value:T) : IObservable
method.return: An IObservable sequence containing the values returned

method.name: concat
method.description: Concatonates multiple sequences by running each sequence as the previous one finishes
method.param: sources The sequences to concatonate after the current sequence
method.return: An observable sequence of the same valueClass as the current sequence

method.name: contains
method.description: Determines if the source sequence contains a specific value
method.param: value The value to check against the sequence
comparer The function used to compare values. Default equality will be used if comparer is null.
method.return: An observable sequence of Boolean

method.name: count
method.description: Returns the number of elements in the source sequence
method.return: An observable sequence of int

method.name: delay
method.description: Delays all values in a sequences by a specified time
method.param: delayMs The amount of time, in milliseconds, to delay
scheduler The scheduler used to delay the values
method.return: An observable sequence of the same type as the current sequence

method.name: dematerialize
method.description: Converts materialized values back into messages
method.return: An observable sequence of valueClass

method.name: distinctUntilChanged
method.description: Filters out consecutive duplicates from a source sequence
method.param:
comparer (optional) The function used to compare values. Default equality will be used if comparer is null.
function(x:TValue, y:TValue) : Boolean
method.return: An observable sequence of the same type as the current sequence

method.name: expand
method.description: Recursively expands the values in the sequence using a selector function
method.param:
selector Accepts values and returns an expanded sequence for them:
function (value : T) : IObservable
method.return: An observable sequence of all values emitted by any of the sequences

method.name: filter
method.description: Filters out values from a source sequence
method.param: predicate The predicate function to execute for each value to determine if it will be include in the output
method.return: An observable sequence of the same valueClass as the current sequence

method.name: finallyAction
method.description: Executes a function when the sequence completes, errors or is unsubscribed from
method.param: finallyAction The function to execute in the event the sequence completes or errors
method.return: An observable sequence of the same type as the current sequence

method.name: firstOrDefault
method.description: Emits the first value in the sequence, or a default value if the sequence completes with no values
method.return: An observable sequence of the same type as the current sequence

method.name: first
method.description: Emits the first value in the sequence, or an error if the sequence completes with no values
method.return: An observable sequence of the same type as the current sequence

method.name: forkJoin
method.description: Combines the current sequence with another, emitting the last values of both after both have completed
method.param: right The sequence to subscribe to, along with the current sequence

selector The function that accepts the last values of both sequences and returns the output value:
function(left : TLeft, right : TRight) : TResult
method.return: An observable sequence of TResult

method.name: groupByUntil
method.description: Groups values by a key and also provides a lifetime for a grouping
method.param:
keySelector A selector that maps the key from a source value:
function(value:TValue):TKey

durationSelector A selector that returns an observable sequence that will signal
the end of the life of a group by emitting a value or completing:
function(group:IGroupedObservable) : IObservable

elementSelector (optional) A selector that maps the source value to the element value that
will be added to the grouped items: function(value:TValue):TElement
keyComparer A equality comparer that compares two keys
method.return: An observable sequence of IGroupedObservable

method.name: groupBy
method.description: Groups values by a key
method.param:
keySelector A selector that maps the key from a source value:
function(value:TValue):TKey

elementSelector (optional) A selector that maps the source value to the element value that
will be added to the grouped items: function(value:TValue):TElement
keyComparer A equality comparer that compares two keys
method.return: An observable sequence of IGroupedObservable

method.name: groupJoin
method.description:
Combines values from two streams based on the "lifetime" of each value, represented by an IObservable
selected for each value. An IObervable set of "right" values are sent with its matching "left" value
to a selector to be combined. The output of this selector is emitted to the output stream
method.param: right The right hand side of the join

joinSelector A function that will accept "live" left/right value combinations and return a new value.
The output of this function will be received by any subscribers:
function(left : TLeft, rights : IObservable.<TRight>) : TResult
method.return: An observable sequence of TResult values

method.name: ignoreValues
method.description: Excludes values (calls to IObserver.onNext), emitting only onCompleted and onError
method.return: An observable sequence

method.name: join
method.description:
Combines values from two streams based on the "lifetime" of each value, represented by an IObservable
selected for each value. All combinations of values from both streams that occur during this "lifetime" window
are sent to a selector to be combined. The output of this selector is emitted to the output stream
method.param: right The right hand side of the join

joinSelector A function that will accept "live" left/right value combinations and return a new value.
The output of this function will be received by any subscribers:
function(left : TLeft, right : TRight) : TResult
method.return: An observable sequence of TResult (returned by joinSelector)

method.name: lastOrDefault
method.description: Emits the last value in the sequence, or the default value if the sequence completes with no values
method.return: An observable sequence of the same type as the current sequence

method.name: last
method.description: Emits the last value in the sequence, or an error if the sequence completes with no values
method.return: An observable sequence of the same type as the current sequence

method.name: let
method.description: Pipes a composed sequence to be mapped through a function so it can be used multiple times
method.param: func The function to send the current sequence through, and return a new sequence
method.return: The observable sequence returned by func

method.name: log
method.description: Writes sequence activity out to the trace log with a message describing the sequence
method.param: message

method.name: mapMany
method.description: Starts a new sequence, returned by selector, for every value in the source sequence and merges their values
method.param: valueClass The valueClass of the sequences returned by selector

selector The function that maps values to new observable sequences that will
be merged in the result set: function(value:TValue):IObservable
method.return: An observable sequence containing the values emitted from the child observable sequences

method.name: map
method.description: Maps the values from a source sequence through a function to change their value
method.param: selector The function to be executed with each value
method.return: An observable sequence of valueClass result

method.name: materialize
method.description: Converts all messages (next, complete, error) into values
method.return: An observable sequence of rx.Notification

method.name: mergeMany
method.description:
Evaluates a new sequence for each value using a selector function and merges the results
of the sequence returned by the returned sequence, optionally constraining the number of
concurrent sequencing.
method.param:
selector Accept a value of the source and returns the IObservable sequence to merge:
function(value:T) : IObservable
method.return: An IObservable sequence containing the values returned

method.name: merge
method.description: Emits the values from multiple sources in the order that they arrive
method.param: sources The other sequences from which the values will be merged with the current sequence
scheduler The scheduler to use
method.return: An observable sequence of the same type as the current sequence

method.name: multiWindow
method.description: Emits values into child "window" observable sequences, which are opened and closed by the caller.
method.param: windowOpenings Signals the start of a new window by emitting a value

windowClosingSelector Returns an observable sequence that will signal the close of a window:
function (window : IObservable) : IObservable
method.return: An observable sequence of the same valueClass as the current sequence

method.name: multicastDefer
method.description:
Creates a connectable sequence that can be shared by multiple observers, using a specific
subject implementation (determined at subscribe-time. The shared sequence will be passed
to a selector function when the sequence is subscribed to.
method.param: subjectSelector Determines the subject to be used when the sequence is subscribed to

selector Accepts the yet-to-be-connected connectable sequence and returns the sequence
that will supply values to the subject
method.return:
An observable sequence that contains messages from the selector-returned sequence, piped
through the subject supplied by subjectSelector

method.name: multicast
method.description:
Creates a connectable sequence that can be shared by multiple observers, using a specific
subject implementation.
method.param: subject The subject that will messages and subscriptions
method.return: A connectable observable

method.name: observeOn
method.description: Defers messages to subscribers through a scheduler
method.param: scheduler The subscriber to send messages to subscribers through
method.return: An observable sequence of the same type as the current sequence

method.name: ofClass
method.description: Filters out values from a source sequence that are not of a specific type
method.param: valueClass The class (or subsclass) of all values to emit
method.return: An observable sequence of valueClass

method.name: onErrorResumeNext
method.description: Subscribes down a list of sequence as each one errors or complete
method.param: second The sequence to run after the current sequence completes or errors
scheduler The scheduler to use to subscribe to the new sequence
method.return: An observable sequence of the same type as the current sequence

method.name: peekWith
method.description: Allows custom code to be run when messages arrive without affecting the observer
method.param: observer The observer that will receive messages

method.name: peek
method.description: Allows custom code to be run when messages arrive without affecting the observer
method.param: next The function to execute in the event of a value (onNext)
complete The function to execute in the event the sequence completes (onComplete)
error The function to execute in the event of an error (onError)
method.return: An observable sequence of the same type as the current sequence

method.name: pruneDefer
method.description:
Creates a shared sequence that emits the last value of the source sequence, the shared
sequence will be passed to the selector function when the sequence is subscribed to.
method.param: selector The function to map the connected sequence through
scheduler The scheduler to use
method.return: An observable sequence of the same type as the current sequence

method.name: prune
method.description: Creates a shared sequence that emits the last value of the source sequence
method.param: scheduler The scheduler to use
method.return: A connectable observable sequence of the same type as the current sequence

method.name: publishDefer
method.description:
Creates a shared sequence that can be used by multiple subscribers, the shared
sequence will be passed to the selector function when the sequence is subscribed to.
method.param: selector The function to map the connected sequence through
method.return: An observable sequence of the same type as the current sequence

method.name: publish
method.description: Creates a connectable sequence that can be shared by multiple observers
method.return: A connectable observable sequence of the same type as the current sequence

method.name: reduce
method.description: Runs calculation functions over every value in the source sequence and emits the final result
method.param:
accumulator A function that accumulates the aggregate value:
function(accumulate : TAccumulate, element : TElement) : TAccumulate
initialValue The value to start with
method.return: An observable sequence of type TAccumulate

method.name: removeTimeInterval
method.description: Removes time interval information added with timeInterval
method.return: An observable sequence of the original values (without being wrapped in TimeInterval)

method.name: removeTimestamp
method.description: Removes timestamp information added with timestamp
method.return: An observable sequence of the original values (without being wrapped in TimeStamp)

method.name: repeat
method.description: Repeats the source sequence a specific number of times
method.param: repeatCount The number of times to repeat the sequence or 0 to repeat indefinitely
method.return: An observable sequence of the same type as the current sequence

method.name: replayDefer
method.description:
Creates a shared sequence that replays values to future subscrubers, the shared
sequence will be passed to the selector function when the sequence is subscribed to
method.param: selector The function to map the connected sequence through
bufferSize The number of values at the end of the sequence to replay, or 0 for all.
windowMs The window of time, in milliseconds, in which to replay values from the end of the sequence, or 0 for all.
scheduler The scheduler to use
method.return: An observable sequence of the same type as the current sequence

method.name: replay
method.description: Records the output of the source sequence and replays it to future subscribers
method.param: bufferSize The number of values at the end of the sequence to replay, or 0 for all.
windowMs The window of time, in milliseconds, in which to replay values from the end of the sequence, or 0 for all.
scheduler The scheduler to use
method.return: A connectable observable sequence of the same valueClass as the current sequence

method.name: retry
method.description: Repeats the source sequence when an error occurs
method.param:
retryCount The number of times to retry the sequence in the event of an error,
or 0 to retry indefinitely
method.return: An observable sequence of the same type as the current sequence

method.name: sample
method.description: Emits the latest value on a time interval from a source sequence
method.param: intervalMs The interval of time, in milliseconds, to sample the current value after
scheduler The scheduler to use
method.return: An observable sequence of the same type as the current sequence

method.name: scan
method.description: Runs calculation functions over every value in the source sequence and emits the value as it is calculated
method.param: accumulator The function that accumulates values
initialValue The value to start with
method.return: An observable sequence of valueClass

method.name: selectMany
method.description: Starts a new sequence, returned by selector, for every value in the source sequence and merges their values
method.param: selector The function to be executed with each value
method.return: An observable sequence of valueClass result

method.name: sequenceEqual
method.description: Determines whether two observable sequences are equal
method.param: other The observable sequence to compare to

valueComparer The equality comparer to compare values between sequences:
function(value : TValue, otherValue : TOther) : Boolean
method.return: An observable sequence that will emit a single boolean value once equality has been determined

method.name: singleOrDefault
method.description:
Emits the only item from a source sequence, the default value if no values are emitted, or
an error if more than one value is emitted.
method.return: An observable sequence of the same valueClass as the current sequence

method.name: single
method.description: Emits the only item from a source sequence, or an error if any other number of values are emitted.
method.return: An observable sequence

method.name: skipLast
method.description: Ignores a set number of values from the end of the source sequence
method.param: count The number of values to skip from the end of the sequence
method.return: An observable sequence of the same valueClass as the current sequence

method.name: skipUntil
method.description: Ignores values from a source sequence until a value is received from a specified sequence
method.param: other The other sequence that will mark the start of values being used from the current sequence
method.return: An observable sequence of the same valueClass as the current sequence

method.name: skipWhile
method.description: Ignores values from a source sequence until a condition is no longer met
method.param: predicate The function to be executed as each value is emitted. When this function returns false, values will be used from the current sequence.
method.return: An observable sequence of the same valueClass as the current sequence

method.name: skip
method.description: Ignores a set number of values from the start of the source sequence
method.param: count The number of values to skip from the start of the sequence
method.return: An observable sequence of the same valueClass as the current sequence

method.name: startWith
method.description: Emits the specified values at the start of a sequence
method.param:
value That value, converted to an IObservable using toObservable, that will
be emitted at the start of the current sequence
method.return: An observable sequence of the same valueClass as the current sequence

method.name: subscribeOn
method.description: Defers subscriptions to the source through a scheduler
method.param: scheduler The subscriber to schedule subscriptions through
method.return: An observable sequence of the same type as the current sequence

method.name: subscribeWith
method.description: Subscribes to this observable using the supplied observer
method.return: An instance of ICancelable that can be used to unsubscribe at anytime by calling cancel()

method.name: subscribe
method.description: Subscribes to this observable using the supplied functions
method.param: onNext Function to be called for every value. Signature is function(payload : T) : void
onComplete Optional. Function to be called when the sequence completes. Signature is function():void
onError Optional. Function to be called when an error occurs in the sequence. Signature is function(err:Error):void
