method.return: An instance of ICancelable that can be used to unsubscribe at anytime by calling cancel()

method.name: sum
method.description: Returns the summed value of all the elements in the source sequence
method.return: An observable sequence of Number

method.name: switchMany
method.description:
Like selectMany, starts a new sequence for every value in the source
sequence but cancels the previous sequence each time.
method.return: An observable sequence of valueClass

method.name: takeLast
method.description: Takes only the last set number of values from a source sequence
method.param: count The number of values to use from the end of the sequence
method.return: An observable sequence of the same valueClass as the current sequence

method.name: takeUntil
method.description: Takes values from a source sequence until a value is received from a specified sequence
method.param: other The other sequence that will mark the end of values being used from the current sequence
method.return: An observable sequence of the same valueClass as the current sequence

method.name: takeWhile
method.description: Takes values from a source sequence until a condition is no longer met
method.param: predicate The function to be executed as each value is emitted. When this function returns false, values will no longer be used from the current sequence.
method.return: An observable sequence of the same valueClass as the current sequence

method.name: take
method.description: Takes only the first set number of values from a source sequenc
method.param: count The number of values to use from the start of the sequence
method.return: An observable sequence of the same valueClass as the current sequence

method.name: then
method.description:
Creates a Plan from this sequence, by supplying a
valueClass and a mappingFunction for the values from each
sequence in this Pattern
method.param: thenFunction The function that will accept this sequence as an argument
method.return: A Plan that can be used with Observable.join

method.name: throttle
method.description: Limits how often values from a source sequence will be accepted from a source
method.param: intervalMs The interval of time, in milliseconds, during which only one value from the source sequence will be accepted
scheduler The scheduler to use
method.return: An observable sequence of the same valueClass as the current sequence

method.name: timeInterval
method.description: Includes, with every value emitted, the amount of time passed since the previous value
method.param: scheduler The scheduler to use to determine time
method.return: An observable sequence of TimeInterval

method.name: timeout
method.description: Raises an error (or subscribes a specified sequence) after a certain period of inactivity
method.param: timeoutMs The amount of time, in milliseconds, after which to raise an error (or subscribe to other)
other The sequence to subscribe to in the event of a timeout. If null, a TimeoutError will be emitted.
scheduler The scheduler to use
method.return: An observable sequence of the same valueClass as the current sequence

method.name: timestamp
method.description: Includes, with every value emitted, the timestamp of when the value was emitted from the source
method.param: scheduler The scheduler to use
method.return: An observable sequence of Timestamped

method.name: toArray
method.description: Delivers all the results as a single array when the source completes
method.return: An observable sequence of Array that will contain the same valueClass as the current sequence

method.name: windowWithCount
method.description: Emits the values from a source sequence in groups of a specific size
method.param: count The number of values to buffer
skip The number of values to offset after the buffer is emitted.
method.return: An observable sequence of observable sequences with the same type as the current sequence

method.name: windowWithTimeOrCount
method.description: Emits IObservable sequences containing values received in sized batches or within a timespan, whichever occurs first
method.param: timeMs The maximum amount of time for a child-sequence to capture values
count The maximum amount of values for a child-sequence to capture
method.return: An observable sequence of observable sequences with the same type as the current sequence

method.name: windowWithTime
method.description: Emits the values from a source sequence in groups of a specific size
method.param: timeMs The amount of time to buffer before the values are released
timeShiftMs The amount of time to offset after the buffer is emitted
scheduler The scheduler to use
method.return: An observable sequence of observable sequences with the same type as the current sequence

method.name: window
method.description: Splits values into child-observable windows which are closed by the caller
method.param:
windowClosingSelector Returns an IObservable that will emit a value or complete to indicate that the active
window has closed. Called on subscription and immediately after each window closes.
method.return: An observable sequence of the same valueClass as the current sequence

method.name: zip
method.description: Merges two sequences through a mapping function while only ever using each value once
method.param: rightSource The sequence to combine with the current
selector The function to be executed when values are received from both sequences. The return value will be included in the output
method.return: An observable sequence of valueClass

classRec.name: Observer
classRec.description: Provides static methods that create observers

method.name: create
method.description: Creates an IObserver from onNext, onCompleted and onError functions
method.param: onNext The function to call when a value is received
onCompleted The function to call when the sequence has complted
onError The function to call if an error occurs in the sequence

classRec.name: Cancelable
classRec.description: Provides static methods that create cancelable resources

method.name: create
method.description: Creates a cancelable resource that calls a function when canceled
method.param: action The function to call when the resource is canceled

method.name: empty
method.description: Returns a cancelable resource that does nothing when canceled

classRec.name: OnError
classRec.description: A Notification for an onError call

method.name: accept
method.description: Calls onError if it's not null

method.name: error
method.description: Gets the error for this message

method.name: hasValue
method.description: Always returns false since no values are associated with errors

method.name: kind
method.description: Always returns NotificationKind.ON_ERROR

method.name: value
method.description: Always returns null since no values are associated with errors

classRec.name: OnCompleted
classRec.description: A Notification for an onCompleted call

method.name: accept
method.description: Calls onCompleted if it's not null

method.name: error
method.description: Always returns false since no errors are associated with completion

method.name: hasValue
method.description: Always returns false since no values are associated with completion

method.name: kind
method.description: Always returns NotificationKind.ON_COMPLETED

method.name: value
method.description: Always returns null since no values are associated with completion

interfaceRec.name: ISubject
interfaceRec.description: A resource that is both observable and an observer

classRec.name: OnNext
classRec.description: A Notification for an onNext call

method.name: accept
method.description: Calls onNext if it's not null

method.name: error
method.description: Always returns false since no errors are associated with values

method.name: hasValue
method.description: Always returns true

method.name: kind
method.description: Always returns NotificationKind.ON_NEXT

method.name: value
method.description: Gets the value from the message

method.name: toObservable
method.description:
Converts a value to an IObservable sequence. It can be considered to have the following overloads:
  • function():IObservable - returns an empty sequence
  • function(array : Array):Observable - returns a sequence that wraps an array
  • function(observable : IObservable):IObservable - returns observable
  • function(enumerable : IEnumerable):IObservable - returns a sequence that wraps eumerable
  • function(error : Error):IObservable - returns a sequence will error when subscribed to
  • function(value : :IEnumerable - returns enumerable that contains a single value

classRec.name: AbsObservable
classRec.description:
Subclass this class only if you want to implement a completely custom IObservable.

If you can avoid it, however, try to stick to subclassing Subject or using one of the creation methods.

This class may be made inaccessible in future revisions

method.name: all
method.description: Determines if all values in the source sequence satisfy a condition
method.param: predicate The predicate that determines if a value in the sequence is valid.
method.return: An observable sequence of Boolean

method.name: and
method.description: Creates a pattern by combining the current source with right.
method.param: right The other sequence to combine with the pattern.
method.return: A pattern representing both sequences

method.name: any
method.description: Determines if the source sequence contains a value that satisfies a condition
method.param:
predicate (optional) The predicate that determines if a value in the sequence is valid.
If null, the returned sequence will emit true if the source sequence contains any values or false if it is empty.
method.return: An observable sequence of Boolean

method.name: asObservable
method.description: Hides the source sequence so it cannot be cast back to its concrete implementation
method.return: An observable sequence of the same type as the current sequence

method.name: average
method.description: Returns the average value of all the elements in the source sequence
method.param: valueSelector (optional) The selector function that returns a numeric value from the source value
method.return: An observable sequence of TSource values

method.name: bufferWithCount
method.description: Emits the values from a source sequence in groups of a specific size
method.param: count The number of values to buffer
skip The number of values to offset after the buffer is emitted.
method.return: An observable sequence of arrays of the the same type as the current sequence

method.name: bufferWithTimeOrCount
method.description:
Buffers values into an array, with one array for either a maximum period of time or a maximum number
of values, whichever occurs first
method.param: timeMs The maximum amount of time to buffer values for
count The maximum amount of values to include in a single buffer
method.return: An observable sequence of observable sequences with the same type as the current sequence

method.name: bufferWithTime
method.description: Emits the values from a source sequence in groups of a specific size
method.param: timeMs The amount of time to buffer before the values are released
timeShiftMs The amount of time to offset after the buffer is emitted
scheduler The scheduler to use
method.return: An observable sequence of Arrays of the same type as the current sequence

method.name: cast
method.description: Forces values from a source sequence to be of a specific class
method.param: valueClass The valueClass of the output sequence
method.return: An observable sequence of valueClass

method.name: catchErrorDefer
method.description: Runs a specific sequence, determined at runtime, when an error occurs
method.param: errorClass The class (and superclass) of error to act on
deferFunc The function to execute in the event of an error. Signature is function(e : Error) : IObservable
method.return: An observable sequence of the same valueClass as the current sequence

method.name: catchError
method.description: Runs a specific sequence when an error occurs
method.param: second The sequence to subscribe to when an error occurs
method.return: An observable sequence of the same type as the current sequence

method.name: chain
method.description:
Chains together sequences, starting with the current sequence, using selector functions that
return a sequence for values of the previous.
method.return:
An observable sequence of the values returned by the sequence returned by the last
selector in the chain

method.name: combineLatest
method.description: Merges two sequences through a mapping function, using the latest value from either source
method.param: right The sequence to combine with
selector The function that combines values from the two sources. Signature is function(left : this.valueClass, right : right.valueClass) : returnType
method.return: An observable sequence of returnType

method.name: concatMany
method.description:
Evaluates a new sequence for each value using a selector function and waits for the returned
sequence to complete before resolving the next sequence
method.param:
selector Accept a value of the source and returns the IObservable sequence to concatonate:
function(value:T) : IObservable
method.return: An IObservable sequence containing the values returned

method.name: concat
method.description: Concatonates multiple sequences by running each sequence as the previous one finishes
method.param: sources The sequences to concatonate after the current sequence
method.return: An observable sequence of the same valueClass as the current sequence

method.name: contains
method.description: Determines if the source sequence contains a specific value
method.param: value The value to check against the sequence
comparer The function used to compare values. Default equality will be used if comparer is null.
method.return: An observable sequence of Boolean

method.name: count
method.description: Returns the number of elements in the source sequence
method.return: An observable sequence of int

method.name: delay
method.description: Delays all values in a sequences by a specified time
method.param: delayMs The amount of time, in milliseconds, to delay
scheduler The scheduler used to delay the values
method.return: An observable sequence of the same type as the current sequence

method.name: dematerialize
method.description: Converts materialized values back into messages
method.return: An observable sequence of valueClass

method.name: distinctUntilChanged
method.description: Filters out consecutive duplicates from a source sequence
method.param:
comparer (optional) The function used to compare values. Default equality will be used if comparer is null.
function(x:TValue, y:TValue) : Boolean
method.return: An observable sequence of the same type as the current sequence

method.name: expand
method.description: Recursively expands the values in the sequence using a selector function
method.param:
selector Accepts values and returns an expanded sequence for them:
function (value : T) : IObservable
method.return: An observable sequence of all values emitted by any of the sequences

method.name: filter
method.description: Filters out values from a source sequence
method.param: predicate The predicate function to execute for each value to determine if it will be include in the output
method.return: An observable sequence of the same valueClass as the current sequence

method.name: finallyAction
method.description: Executes a function when the sequence completes, errors or is unsubscribed from
method.param: finallyAction The function to execute in the event the sequence completes or errors
method.return: An observable sequence of the same type as the current sequence

method.name: firstOrDefault
method.description: Emits the first value in the sequence, or a default value if the sequence completes with no values
method.return: An observable sequence of the same type as the current sequence

method.name: first
method.description: Emits the first value in the sequence, or an error if the sequence completes with no values
method.return: An observable sequence of the same type as the current sequence

method.name: forkJoin
method.description: Combines the current sequence with another, emitting the last values of both after both have completed
method.param: right The sequence to subscribe to, along with the current sequence

selector The function that accepts the last values of both sequences and returns the output value:
function(left : TLeft, right : TRight) : TResult
method.return: An observable sequence of TResult

method.name: groupByUntil
method.description: Groups values by a key and also provides a lifetime for a grouping
method.param:
keySelector A selector that maps the key from a source value:
function(value:TValue):TKey

durationSelector A selector that returns an observable sequence that will signal
the end of the life of a group by emitting a value or completing:
function(group:IGroupedObservable) : IObservable

elementSelector (optional) A selector that maps the source value to the element value that
will be added to the grouped items: function(value:TValue):TElement
keyComparer A equality comparer that compares two keys
method.return: An observable sequence of IGroupedObservable

method.name: groupBy
method.description: Groups values by a key
method.param:
keySelector A selector that maps the key from a source value:
function(value:TValue):TKey

elementSelector (optional) A selector that maps the source value to the element value that
will be added to the grouped items: function(value:TValue):TElement
keyComparer A equality comparer that compares two keys
method.return: An observable sequence of IGroupedObservable

method.name: groupJoin
method.description:
Combines values from two streams based on the "lifetime" of each value, represented by an IObservable
selected for each value. An IObervable set of "right" values are sent with its matching "left" value
to a selector to be combined. The output of this selector is emitted to the output stream
method.param: right The right hand side of the join

joinSelector A function that will accept "live" left/right value combinations and return a new value.
The output of this function will be received by any subscribers:
function(left : TLeft, rights : IObservable.<TRight>) : TResult
method.return: An observable sequence of TResult values

method.name: ignoreValues
method.description: Excludes values (calls to IObserver.onNext), emitting only onCompleted and onError
method.return: An observable sequence

method.name: join
method.description:
Combines values from two streams based on the "lifetime" of each value, represented by an IObservable
selected for each value. All combinations of values from both streams that occur during this "lifetime" window
are sent to a selector to be combined. The output of this selector is emitted to the output stream
method.param: right The right hand side of the join

joinSelector A function that will accept "live" left/right value combinations and return a new value.
The output of this function will be received by any subscribers:
function(left : TLeft, right : TRight) : TResult
method.return: An observable sequence of TResult (returned by joinSelector)

method.description: Emits the last value in the sequence, or the default value if the sequence completes with no values

method.name: last
method.description: Emits the last value in the sequence, or an error if the sequence completes with no values
method.return: An observable sequence of the same type as the current sequence

method.description: Pipes a composed sequence to be mapped through a function so it can be used multiple times

method.description: Starts a new sequence, returned by selector, for every value in the source sequence and merges their values

selector The function that maps values to new observable sequences that will
be merged in the result set: function(value:TValue):IObservable
method.return: An observable sequence containing the values emitted from the child observable sequences

method.name: map
method.description: Maps the values from a source sequence through a function to change their value
method.param: selector The function to be executed with each value
method.return: An observable sequence of valueClass result

method.name: materialize
method.description: Converts all messages (next, complete, error) into values
method.return: An observable sequence of rx.Notification

method.name: mergeMany
method.description:
Evaluates a new sequence for each value using a selector function and merges the results
of the sequence returned by the returned sequence, optionally constraining the number of
concurrent sequencing.
method.param:
selector Accept a value of the source and returns the IObservable sequence to merge:
function(value:T) : IObservable
method.return: An IObservable sequence containing the values returned

method.name: merge
method.description: Emits the values from multiple sources in the order that they arrive
method.param: sources The other sequences from which the values will be merged with the current sequence
scheduler The scheduler to use
method.return: An observable sequence of the same type as the current sequence

method.name: multiWindow
method.description: Emits values into child "window" observable sequences, which are opened and closed by the caller.
method.param: windowOpenings Signals the start of a new window by emitting a value

windowClosingSelector Returns an observable sequence that will signal the close of a window:
function (window : IObservable) : IObservable
method.return: An observable sequence of the same valueClass as the current sequence

method.name: multicastDefer
method.description:
Creates a connectable sequence that can be shared by multiple observers, using a specific
subject implementation (determined at subscribe-time. The shared sequence will be passed
to a selector function when the sequence is subscribed to.
method.param: subjectSelector Determines the subject to be used when the sequence is subscribed to

selector Accepts the yet-to-be-connected connectable sequence and returns the sequence
that will supply values to the subject
method.return:
An observable sequence that contains messages from the selector-returned sequence, piped
through the subject supplied by subjectSelector

method.name: multicast
method.description:
Creates a connectable sequence that can be shared by multiple observers, using a specific
subject implementation.
method.param: subject The subject that will messages and subscriptions
method.return: A connectable observable

method.name: observeOn
method.description: Defers messages to subscribers through a scheduler
method.param: scheduler The subscriber to send messages to subscribers through
method.return: An observable sequence of the same type as the current sequence

method.name: ofClass
method.description: Filters out values from a source sequence that are not of a specific type
method.param: valueClass The class (or subsclass) of all values to emit
method.return: An observable sequence of valueClass

method.name: onErrorResumeNext
method.description: Subscribes down a list of sequence as each one errors or complete
method.param: second The sequence to run after the current sequence completes or errors
scheduler The scheduler to use to subscribe to the new sequence
method.return: An observable sequence of the same type as the current sequence

method.name: peekWith
method.description: Allows custom code to be run when messages arrive without affecting the observer
method.param: observer The observer that will receive messages

method.name: peek
method.description: Allows custom code to be run when messages arrive without affecting the observer
method.param: next The function to execute in the event of a value (onNext)
complete The function to execute in the event the sequence completes (onComplete)
error The function to execute in the event of an error (onError)
method.return: An observable sequence of the same type as the current sequence

method.name: pruneDefer
method.description:
Creates a shared sequence that emits the last value of the source sequence, the shared
sequence will be passed to the selector function when the sequence is subscribed to.
method.param: selector The function to map the connected sequence through
scheduler The scheduler to use
method.return: An observable sequence of the same type as the current sequence

method.name: prune
method.description: Creates a shared sequence that emits the last value of the source sequence
method.param: scheduler The scheduler to use
method.return: A connectable observable sequence of the same type as the current sequence

method.name: publishDefer
method.description:
Creates a shared sequence that can be used by multiple subscribers, the shared
sequence will be passed to the selector function when the sequence is subscribed to.
method.param: selector The function to map the connected sequence through
method.return: An observable sequence of the same type as the current sequence

method.name: publish
method.description: Creates a connectable sequence that can be shared by multiple observers
method.return: A connectable observable sequence of the same type as the current sequence

method.name: reduce
method.description: Runs calculation functions over every value in the source sequence and emits the final result
method.param:
accumulator A function that accumulates the aggregate value:
function(accumulate : TAccumulate, element : TElement) : TAccumulate
initialValue The value to start with
method.return: An observable sequence of type TAccumulate

method.name: removeTimeInterval
method.description: Removes time interval information added with timeInterval
method.return: An observable sequence of the original values (without being wrapped in TimeInterval)

method.name: removeTimestamp
method.description: Removes timestamp information added with timestamp
method.return: An observable sequence of the original values (without being wrapped in TimeStamp)

method.name: repeat
method.description: Repeats the source sequence a specific number of times
method.param: repeatCount The number of times to repeat the sequence or 0 to repeat indefinitely
method.return: An observable sequence of the same type as the current sequence

method.name: replayDefer
method.description:
Creates a shared sequence that replays values to future subscrubers, the shared
sequence will be passed to the selector function when the sequence is subscribed to
method.param: selector The function to map the connected sequence through
bufferSize The number of values at the end of the sequence to replay, or 0 for all.
windowMs The window of time, in milliseconds, in which to replay values from the end of the sequence, or 0 for all.
scheduler The scheduler to use
method.return: An observable sequence of the same type as the current sequence

method.name: replay
method.description: Records the output of the source sequence and replays it to future subscribers
method.param: bufferSize The number of values at the end of the sequence to replay, or 0 for all.
windowMs The window of time, in milliseconds, in which to replay values from the end of the sequence, or 0 for all.
scheduler The scheduler to use
method.return: A connectable observable sequence of the same valueClass as the current sequence

method.name: retry
method.description: Repeats the source sequence when an error occurs
method.param:
retryCount The number of times to retry the sequence in the event of an error,
or 0 to retry indefinitely
method.return: An observable sequence of the same type as the current sequence

method.name: sample
method.description: Emits the latest value on a time interval from a source sequence
method.param: intervalMs The interval of time, in milliseconds, to sample the current value after
scheduler The scheduler to use
method.return: An observable sequence of the same type as the current sequence

method.name: scan
method.description: Runs calculation functions over every value in the source sequence and emits the value as it is calculated
method.param: accumulator The function that accumulates values
initialValue The value to start with
method.return: An observable sequence of valueClass

method.name: selectMany
method.description: Starts a new sequence, returned by selector, for every value in the source sequence and merges their values
method.param: selector The function to be executed with each value
method.return: An observable sequence of valueClass result

method.name: sequenceEqual
method.description: Determines whether two observable sequences are equal
method.param: other The observable sequence to compare to

valueComparer The equality comparer to compare values between sequences:
function(value : TValue, otherValue : TOther) : Boolean
method.return: An observable sequence that will emit a single boolean value once equality has been determined

method.name: singleOrDefault
method.description:
Emits the only item from a source sequence, the default value if no values are emitted, or
an error if more than one value is emitted.
method.return: An observable sequence of the same valueClass as the current sequence

method.name: single
method.description: Emits the only item from a source sequence, or an error if any other number of values are emitted.
method.return: An observable sequence

method.name: skipLast
method.description: Ignores a set number of values from the end of the source sequence
method.param: count The number of values to skip from the end of the sequence
method.return: An observable sequence of the same valueClass as the current sequence

method.name: skipUntil
method.description: Ignores values from a source sequence until a value is received from a specified sequence
method.param: other The other sequence that will mark the start of values being used from the current sequence
method.return: An observable sequence of the same valueClass as the current sequence

method.name: skipWhile
method.description: Ignores values from a source sequence until a condition is no longer met
method.param: predicate The function to be executed as each value is emitted. When this function returns false, values will be used from the current sequence.
method.return: An observable sequence of the same valueClass as the current sequence

method.name: skip
method.description: Ignores a set number of values from the start of the source sequence
method.param: count The number of values to skip from the start of the sequence
method.return: An observable sequence of the same valueClass as the current sequence

method.name: startWith
method.description: Emits the specified values at the start of a sequence
method.param:
value That value, converted to an IObservable using toObservable, that will
be emitted at the start of the current sequence
method.return: An observable sequence of the same valueClass as the current sequence

method.name: subscribeOn
method.description: Defers subscriptions to the source through a scheduler
method.param: scheduler The subscriber to schedule subscriptions through
method.return: An observable sequence of the same type as the current sequence

method.name: subscribeWith
method.description: Subscribes to this observable using the supplied observer
method.return: An instance of ICancelable that can be used to unsubscribe at anytime by calling cancel()

method.name: subscribe
method.description: Subscribes to this observable using the supplied functions
method.param: onNext Function to be called for every value. Signature is function(payload : T) : void
onComplete Optional. Function to be called when the sequence completes. Signature is function():void
onError Optional. Function to be called when an error occurs in the sequence. Signature is function(err:Error):void
method.return: An instance of ICancelable that can be used to unsubscribe at anytime by calling cancel()

method.name: sum
method.description: Returns the summed value of all the elements in the source sequence
method.return: An observable sequence of Number

method.name: switchMany
method.description:
Like selectMany, starts a new sequence for every value in the source
sequence but cancels the previous sequence each time.
method.return: An observable sequence of valueClass

method.name: takeLast
method.description: Takes only the last set number of values from a source sequence
method.param: count The number of values to use from the end of the sequence
method.return: An observable sequence of the same valueClass as the current sequence

method.name: takeUntil
method.description: Takes values from a source sequence until a value is received from a specified sequence
method.param: other The other sequence that will mark the end of values being used from the current sequence
method.return: An observable sequence of the same valueClass as the current sequence

method.name: takeWhile
method.description: Takes values from a source sequence until a condition is no longer met
method.param: predicate The function to be executed as each value is emitted. When this function returns false, values will no longer be used from the current sequence.
method.return: An observable sequence of the same valueClass as the current sequence

method.name: take
method.description: Takes only the first set number of values from a source sequenc
method.param: count The number of values to use from the start of the sequence
method.return: An observable sequence of the same valueClass as the current sequence

method.name: then
method.description:
Creates a Plan from this sequence, by supplying a
valueClass and a mappingFunction for the values from each
sequence in this Pattern
method.param: thenFunction The function that will accept this sequence as an argument
method.return: A Plan that can be used with Observable.join

method.name: throttle
method.description: Limits how often values from a source sequence will be accepted from a source
method.param: intervalMs The interval of time, in milliseconds, during which only one value from the source sequence will be accepted
scheduler The scheduler to use
method.return: An observable sequence of the same valueClass as the current sequence

method.name: timeInterval
method.description: Includes, with every value emitted, the amount of time passed since the previous value
method.param: scheduler The scheduler to use to determine time
method.return: An observable sequence of TimeInterval

method.name: timeout
method.description: Raises an error (or subscribes a specified sequence) after a certain period of inactivity
method.param: timeoutMs The amount of time, in milliseconds, after which to raise an error (or subscribe to other)
other The sequence to subscribe to in the event of a timeout. If null, a TimeoutError will be emitted.
scheduler The scheduler to use
method.return: An observable sequence of the same valueClass as the current sequence

method.name: timestamp
method.description: Includes, with every value emitted, the timestamp of when the value was emitted from the source
method.param: scheduler The scheduler to use
method.return: An observable sequence of Timestamped

method.name: toArray
method.description: Delivers all the results as a single array when the source completes
method.return: An observable sequence of Array that will contain the same valueClass as the current sequence

method.name: windowWithCount
method.description: Emits the values from a source sequence in groups of a specific size
method.param: count The number of values to buffer
skip The number of values to offset after the buffer is emitted.
method.return: An observable sequence of observable sequences with the same type as the current sequence

method.name: windowWithTimeOrCount
method.description: Emits IObservable sequences containing values received in sized batches or within a timespan, whichever occurs first
method.param: timeMs The maximum amount of time for a child-sequence to capture values
count The maximum amount of values for a child-sequence to capture
method.return: An observable sequence of observable sequences with the same type as the current sequence

method.name: windowWithTime
method.description: Emits the values from a source sequence in groups of a specific size
method.param: timeMs The amount of time to buffer before the values are released
timeShiftMs The amount of time to offset after the buffer is emitted
scheduler The scheduler to use
method.return: An observable sequence of observable sequences with the same type as the current sequence

method.name: window
method.description: Splits values into child-observable windows which are closed by the caller
method.param:
windowClosingSelector Returns an IObservable that will emit a value or complete to indicate that the active
window has closed. Called on subscription and immediately after each window closes.
method.return: An observable sequence of the same valueClass as the current sequence

method.name: zip
method.description: Merges two sequences through a mapping function while only ever using each value once
method.param: rightSource The sequence to combine with the current
selector The function to be executed when values are received from both sequences. The return value will be included in the output
method.return: An observable sequence of valueClass

classRec.name: Subject
classRec.description:
A Subject is both an IObservable and an IObserver, so it can be returned as an IObservable and fed values through the IObserver methods.

When returning a Subject as an IObservable, it's recommended that you return subject.asObservable() to hide the original instance

method.name: onCompleted
method.description:
Notifies the subscriber that the sequence has completed and
that no more messages will be received

method.name: onError
method.description:
Notifies the subscriber that the sequence has halted with an error
and that no more messages will be received

method.name: onNext
method.description: Notifies the subscriber that a value has been received

method.name: subscribeWith
method.description: Subscribes to this observable using the supplied observer
method.return: An instance of ICancelable that can be used to unsubscribe at anytime by calling cancel()

method.name: hasSubscriptions
method.description: Determines whether this subject has any subscriptions

method.name: subscriptionCount
method.description: Gets the number of subscriptions this subject has

classRec.name: Observable
classRec.description: Provides static methods that create IObservable sequences

method.name: amb
method.description: Takes multiple source sequences and returns values from the first sequence to emit a value
method.param: sources The sources that will be subscribed to
method.return: An observable sequence of the same valueClass as the first sequence in sources

method.name: catchErrors
method.description: Concatonates a list of sequences as each one errors. A successful sequence ends the concatonation.
method.param: sources The list of sequence to concatonate.
scheduler The scheduler used to control flow
method.return: An observable sequence with the valueClass of the first sequence in sources

method.name: concat
method.description: Concatonates multiple sequences by running each sequence as the previous one finishes
method.param: sources Anything that can be converted to an IObservable of IObservables using toObservable
method.return: An observable sequence of valueClass

method.name: createWithCancelable
method.description: Creates a custom observable sequence that uses cancelable resources
method.param: subscribeFunc The function that will be executed when a subscriber subscribes, the return value of which is an ICancelable to be canceled when the sequence is terminated
method.return: An observable sequence of valueClass

method.name: create
method.description: Creates a custom observable sequence
method.param: subscribeFunc The function that will be executed when a subscriber subscribes, the return value of which is a function to be run when the sequence is terminated
method.return: An observable sequence of valueClass

method.name: defer
method.description: Defers selection of a sequence until the sequence is subscribed to
method.param: observableFactory The function that will be executed when a new subscription occurs, the returned sequence will be used for the subscriber.
method.return: An observable sequence of valueClass

method.name: empty
method.description: Creates a sequence that immediately completes
method.param: scheduler The scheduler to use
method.return: An observable sequence of valueClass

method.name: error
method.description: Creates a sequence that immediately throws an Error
method.param: error The error to raise when a new subscription occurs
valueClass The Class of the returned sequence
method.return: An observable sequence of valueClass

method.name: forkJoin
method.description: Subscribes to multiple source sequence and emits the last values of each after all have completed
method.param: sources The sequences to subscribe to
method.return: An observable sequence of Array

method.name: fromArray
method.description: Creates a sequence consisting of the values in an Array
method.param: values The array of values to iterate through
scheduler The scheduler used to control flow
method.return: An observable sequence of elementClass

method.name: fromErrorEvents
method.description: Creates a sequence that emits an error when one of several event valueClasss is received from an IEventDispatcher
method.param: eventDispatcher The IEventDispatcher that dispatches the event
eventTypes The event types that signify an error
useCapture Whether to pass useCapture when subscribing to and unsubscribing from the event
priority The priority of the event
errorMap The function that maps an event to an Error. null can be used if the event will be ErrorEvent
method.return: An observable sequence of

method.name: fromErrorEvent
method.description: Creates a sequence that emits an error when an event is received from an IEventDispatcher
method.param: eventDispatcher The IEventDispatcher that dispatches the event
eventType The event type
useCapture Whether to pass useCapture when subscribing to and unsubscribing from the event
priority The priority of the event
errorMap The function that maps an event to an Error. null can be used if the event will be ErrorEvent
method.return: An observable sequence of valueClass, or Object if valueClass is null

method.name: fromEvents
method.description: Creates Combines events from multiple event valueClasss
method.param: eventDispatcher The IEventDispatcher that dispatches the event
eventTypes An array event type names
useCapture Whether to pass useCapture when subscribing to and unsubscribing from the event
priority The priority of the event
method.return: An observable sequence of commonValueClass, or Event if commonValueClass is null

method.name: fromEvent
method.description: Creates a sequence of events from an IEventDispatcher
method.param: eventDispatcher The IEventDispatcher that dispatches the event
eventType The valueClass of event dispatched by eventDispatcher. Event will be used if this argument is null.
useCapture Whether to pass useCapture when subscribing to and unsubscribing from the event
priority The priority of the event
method.return: An observable sequence of eventType, or Event if eventType is null

method.name: generate
method.description: Creates a custom observable sequence that is controlled by methods supplied as arguments
method.param: initialState The initial state value to use (of class valueClass)
predicate The predicate to determine whether the sequence has completed
iterate The function executed between iterations
resultMap The function that maps the current state to an output value
scheduler The scheduler used to control flow
method.return: An observable sequence of valueClass

method.name: ifElse
method.description: Defers selection of one of two sequences until the sequence is subscribed to
method.param: predicate The function to execute when a subscription occurs to determine which sequence to subscribe to
ifTrue The sequence to subscribe to if predicate returns true
ifFalse The sequence to subscribe to if predicate returns false
method.return: An observable sequence of valueClass

method.name: interval
method.description: Creates an unending observable sequence of integers that are incremented at a regular interval
method.param: intervalMs The interval, in milliseconds, to wait in between values
scheduler The scheduler used for timing
method.return: An observable sequence of int

method.name: lookup
method.description: Defers selection of the sequence to use by using a function that returns a key into a dictionary of sequences
method.param: keySelector The function that, at the moment of subscription, will return the key into dictionary
dictionary The dictionary of sequences
method.return: An observable sequence of valueClass

method.name: merge
method.description: Emits the values from multiple sources in the order that they arrive
method.param: source Either an array of IObservable or an IObservable of IObservables
scheduler The scheduler used to control flow
method.return: An observable sequence of valueClass

method.name: never
method.description: Returns an IObservable that never completes

method.name: onErrorResumeNext
method.description: Concatonates a list of sequence as each one errors or complete

method.description: Creates a sequence of consecutive integers

count The number of values, including start, to emit
scheduler The scheduler to use
method.return: An observable sequence of int

method.name: repeatValue
method.description: Repeats a value a specification number of times

repeatCount The number of times to emit the value
scheduler The scheduler to use

method.name: start
method.description: Creates a sequence based on a call to a function

method.description: Creates an unending observable sequence of integers that begin after a delay and are incremented at a regular interval

intervalMs The interval, in milliseconds, to wait in between subsequent values

method.description: Converts a function into an observable sequence

A function accepting the arguments of the original action, but that will
return an IObservable when called.

method.description: Create a sequence consisting of exactly one value

Gets the maximum number of urlLoaders that can execute concurrently. The value

method.name: maxConcurrentLoaders

Sets the maximum number of urlLoaders that can execute concurrently. Use 0 for

classRec.name: GreenThreadScheduler
classRec.description:
A scheduler that distributes work on a timer, limiting the total execution time per 'switch' to maintain a framerate

Adding more work results in the work taking longer to complete, but the framerate remaining constant

To benefit from GreenThreadScheduler, scheduled actions should execute in this smallest possible time (ie. be designed to be run many times

interfaceRec.name: IConnectableObservable
interfaceRec.description:
Represents a 'pending' hot observable. Calling connect will turn the observable
into a hot observable. Calling refCount will turn the observable into a hot observable
when the first observer subscribes

method.name: connect
method.description:
Makes this observable 'hot', so that values will be
emitted whether there is a subscriber connected or not.

method.name: refCount
method.description:
Makes this observable 'hot' when an observer subscribes, and
will cancel the source subscription when the last observer unsubscribes

classRec.name: AsyncSubject

A subject that replays the last value (or error) received to observers that subscribe
after the sequence has completed
